revised_title: Astronomical Observations and Techniques by John Smeaton and Nevil Maskelyne
tldr: The author introduces two papers by John Smeaton that discuss methods for observing the positions of celestial bodies and calculating their parallax. The papers also propose a new method for measuring the places of heavenly bodies outside the meridian, independent of refraction. These techniques are valuable for improving astronomical calculations and understanding the dimensions of planetary orbits.
